intro: Daphnopsis angustifolia var. nipensis, commonly known as the Japanese narrowleaf daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a woody stem and opposite leaf arrangement. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to temperate climates.
